inclusion.criterion: PVD defined as significant pain at vestibular contact and vaginal entry
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: VAS ≥ 6 at the tampon test or severe pain, preventing intercourse
inclusion.label: unknown
met
inclusion.evidence: Further review of systems is notable for absence of chest pain, dyspnea on exertion, paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea, orthopnea, palpitations, syncope or presyncope.

inclusion.criterion: Patients who are willing to participate in the study after it has been explained orally and in writing will be included.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Dermatological conditions or other causes to dyspareunia
exclusion.label: unknown
met
exclusion.evidence: Prior to CABG he only had diaphoresis.

exclusion.criterion: Known allergy to any components of the active drug (Botox®)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Medical disease contradictory to treatment with the active drug (Botox®)
exclusion.label: met
exclusion.evidence: Hypertension, Diabetes c/b retinopathy and peripheral neuropathy

exclusion.criterion: Peripheral motor neurological disease such as myasthenia gravis, amyotrophic lateral sclerosis or Lambert-Eaton syndrome
exclusion.label: unknown
met
exclusion.evidence: Hypertension, Diabetes c/b retinopathy and peripheral neuropathy

notes: Patient has significant bilateral carotid artery disease with an 80% stenosis of the R ICA and a 90% L ICA stenosis. He also reports occasional dizziness, no prior syncope, occasional HA, Denies CP/SOB.
